Package util

Class FXUtil

java.lang.Object
util.FXUtil
public class FXUtil extends Object
Utility class for common JavaFX operations used throughout the library.

Provides helper methods for signaling UI element borders, enabling zoom and pan behavior for images in scroll panes, and creating modal popup windows.

All methods are static and the class is not intended to be instantiated.

Author:
Felix Seggeb√§ing

      public FXUtil()

  • Method Details

    • signalBorder

      public static void signalBorder(javafx.scene.Node node)
      Temporarily highlights the border of the given JavaFX node by making it flash red.

      Intended to draw the user's attention to a specific UI element (e.g., in case of invalid input). The border will return to its default style after the animation completes.

      Parameters:
      node - the JavaFX UI element to signal

    • initializeZoomableScrollPane

      public static Consumer<javafx.scene.image.Image> initializeZoomableScrollPane(javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane scrollPane)
      Initializes the given ScrollPane so that it supports zooming and panning for images.

      Sets up an ImageView inside a Group as the scroll pane's content. Enables smooth zooming via mouse wheel (with Ctrl), keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl + Plus/Minus), and panning via mouse drag. The zoom level is dynamically limited so that the image always fits in the viewport (minScale) and cannot exceed 4x zoom (maxScale).

      Returns a Consumer that can be used to set a new Image in the zoomable view, automatically resetting the zoom to the minimum scale so the image fits.

      Parameters:
      scrollPane - the ScrollPane to be initialized for zoom and pan functionality
      Returns:
      a consumer that displays an image in the scroll pane and resets zoom

    • createModalPopup

      public static javafx.stage.Stage createModalPopup(javafx.stage.Window parent, javafx.scene.Parent content, double offsetX, double offsetY, String title)
      Creates and configures a modal popup Stage with the specified content and positioning.

      The popup is centered with the given offsets relative to the parent window and uses Modality.WINDOW_MODAL.

      Parameters:
      parent - the parent window for modality and positioning
      content - the content to display in the popup
      offsetX - the horizontal offset from the parent window's X position
      offsetY - the vertical offset from the parent window's Y position
      title - the window title for the popup
      Returns:
      the configured and ready-to-show modal Stage
